verses.verse: Behold, thou art fair<WH3303>, my love<WH7474>; behold, thou art fair<WH3303>; thou hast doves'<WH3123> eyes<WH5869> within<WH1157> thy locks<WH6777>: thy hair<WH8181> is as a flock<WH5739> of goats<WH5795>, that appear<WH1570> from mount<WH2022> Gilead<WH1568>. that: or, that eat of, etc

Thy teeth<WH8127> are like a flock<WH5739> of sheep that are even shorn<WH7094>, which came up<WH5927> from the washing<WH7367>; whereof every one bear twins<WH8382>, and none is barren<WH7909> among them.

Thy lips<WH8193> are like a thread<WH2339> of scarlet<WH8144>, and thy speech<WH4057> is comely<WH5000>: thy temples<WH7541> are like a piece<WH6400> of a pomegranate<WH7416> within<WH1157> thy locks<WH6777>.

Thy neck<WH6677> is like the tower<WH4026> of David<WH1732> builded<WH1129> for an armoury<WH8530>, whereon there hang<WH8518> a thousand<WH505> bucklers<WH4043>, all shields<WH7982> of mighty men<WH1368>.
Thy two<WH8147> breasts<WH7699> are like two<WH8147> young<WH6082> roes<WH6646> that are twins<WH8380>, which feed<WH7462> among the lilies<WH7799>.

Until the day<WH3117> break<WH6315>, and the shadows<WH6752> flee away<WH5127>, I will get<WH3212> me to the mountain<WH2022> of myrrh<WH4753>, and to the hill<WH1389> of frankincense<WH3828>. break: Heb. breathe
Thou art all fair<WH3303>, my love<WH7474>; there is no spot<WH3971> in thee.

Come<WH935> with me from Lebanon<WH3844>, my spouse<WH3618>, with me from Lebanon<WH3844>: look<WH7789> from the top<WH7218> of Amana<WH549>, from the top<WH7218> of Shenir<WH8149> and Hermon<WH2768>, from the lions'<WH738> dens<WH4585>, from the mountains<WH2042> of the leopards<WH5246>.

Thou hast ravished my heart<WH3823>, my sister<WH269>, my spouse<WH3618>; thou hast ravished my heart<WH3823> with one<WH259> of thine eyes<WH5869>, with one<WH259> chain<WH6060> of thy neck<WH6677>. ravished: or, taken away

How fair<WH3302> is thy love<WH1730>, my sister<WH269>, my spouse<WH3618>! how much better<WH2895> is thy love<WH1730> than wine<WH3196>! and the smell<WH7381> of thine ointments<WH8081> than all spices<WH1314>!

Thy lips<WH8193>, O my spouse<WH3618>, drop<WH5197> as the honeycomb<WH5317>: honey<WH1706> and milk<WH2461> are under thy tongue<WH3956>; and the smell<WH7381> of thy garments<WH8008> is like the smell<WH7381> of Lebanon<WH3844>.
A garden<WH1588> inclosed<WH5274> is my sister<WH269>, my spouse<WH3618>; a spring<WH1530> shut up<WH5274>, a fountain<WH4599> sealed<WH2856>. inclosed: Heb. barred shut up: Heb. barred
Thy plants<WH7973> are an orchard<WH6508> of pomegranates<WH7416>, with pleasant<WH4022> fruits<WH6529>; camphire<WH3724>, with spikenard<WH5373>, camphire: or, cypress
Spikenard<WH5373> and saffron<WH3750>; calamus<WH7070> and cinnamon<WH7076>, with all trees<WH6086> of frankincense<WH3828>; myrrh<WH4753> and aloes<WH174>, with all the chief<WH7218> spices<WH1314>:
A fountain<WH4599> of gardens<WH1588>, a well<WH875> of living<WH2416> waters<WH4325>, and streams<WH5140> from Lebanon<WH3844>.

Awake<WH5782>, O north wind<WH6828>; and come<WH935>, thou south<WH8486>; blow<WH6315> upon my garden<WH1588>, that the spices<WH1314> thereof may flow out<WH5140>. Let my beloved<WH1730> come<WH935> into his garden<WH1588>, and eat<WH398> his pleasant<WH4022> fruits<WH6529>.
